alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Elk; McKean; Northern Clinton; Potter (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 2:38AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM... At 235 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northeastern Elk County and northern Cameron County, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sizerville and Cameron around 240 AM EDT. Wharton around 250 AM EDT. Tamarack around 300 AM EDT. Cross Fork around 305 AM EDT. Ole Bull State Park around 310 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Austin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Cameron; Elk; McKean; Northern Clinton; Potter
